p: In general, herbs and plants are rich in compounds with antioxidant properties, such as vitamins (E and C), glutathione, enzymes and phenolic compounds [ 2]. Several spice extracts have shown their properties to prevent the autoxidation of unsaturated triacylglycerols [ 3]. Specifically, the natural extract from the Lamiaceae family (thyme, sage and rosemary) has been reported in several studies for its antioxidative activity [ 1, 4].
